name: @jsonic/jsonic-next
description: A fast pattern matcher on JavaScript object properties.
author: Richard Rodger (http://richardrodger.com)

scripts.build: node hint.js && tsc -d && node mfix.js && cp jsonic.js jsonic.min.js && browserify -o jsonic.min.js -e jsonic.js -s Jsonic -im -i assert -p tinyify
scripts.test-web-x: npm run build && browserify -o test-web/test-web.js -e test/web-all.js -s All -im -i assert -i @hapi/lab && open test-web/index.html
scripts.reset: npm run clean && npm i && npm test
scripts.repo-tag: REPO_VERSION=`node -e "console.log(require('./package').version)"` && echo TAG: v$REPO_VERSION && git commit -a -m v$REPO_VERSION && git push && git tag v$REPO_VERSION && git push --tags;
scripts.repo-publish: npm run clean && npm i && npm run repo-publish-quick
scripts.repo-publish-quick: npm run prettier && npm run build && npm run test && npm run test-web && npm run repo-tag && npm publish --registry https://registry.npmjs.org --access=public
